We are looking for a passionate Research and Data Manager to join our team! As part of the Marketing and Membership Engagement teams, you will help organize, annotate, interpret, and disseminate research findings internally and externally. You will also provide data collection and research support for our programs and services, finding existing research and data from a variety of sources relevant to our organization's work. The role reports to the SVP, Marketing and Member Engagement and works closely with other department heads.We are seeking someone who is driven, adaptable, principled, a team player, and has a desire to be of service. The successful candidate will have at least 3 years of research, survey management or equivalent experience, and a Bachelor's degree in business, marketing, computer science, or a related field, or an equivalent combination of relevant education and work experience.ResponsibilitiesAs our Research and Data Manager, your responsibilities will include:Coordinating surveys and collecting data on demographics, purchasing habits, sponsorships, and loyalty, and reporting results to staff and sponsors.Devising and evaluating methods and procedures for collecting data, such as surveys, opinion polls, or questionnaires, or arranging to obtain existing data.Measuring the effectiveness of marketing, advertising, and communications programs and strategies.Forecasting and tracking marketing and sales trends, analyzing collected data.Gathering data on competitors and analyzing their prices, sales, and method of marketing and distribution.Monitoring industry statistics and following trends in trade literature.Interpreting and translating data into easy-to-understand communications.Monitoring, tracking, and responding to data requests from both internal and external audiences.Following data privacy policies and complying with data protection regulations.Creating and blending text, data tables, charts, and graphics together to produce integrated reports.Using intermediate level skills with word processing, spreadsheet, and presentation software (Microsoft word, Excel, and PowerPoint preferred).Being competent with video conferencing platforms for conducting meetings and virtual focus groups.Working efficiently while managing multiple projects/tasks/systems simultaneously.Performing other duties as assigned.Being required to travel and attend as requested to EXPO.QualificationsBachelor's degree in business, marketing, computer science, or related field required. Or an equivalent combination of relevant education and work experience.Experience using various types of data software for database reporting, data analysis, object or component-oriented development, database user interface and query, customer relationship management (CRM), financial analysis, and point of sale (POS).At least 3 years of research, survey management or equivalent experience.Understanding or research methodologies, standards, and best practices is required.Strong analytical, organizational, writing, and communication skills.Ability to analyze and synthesize large amounts of data and put forward evidence-based recommendations to help grow revenue.Ability to conduct sophisticated searches in electronic and print sources and use data mining tools.Skilled in developing and implementing new strategies and procedures to conduct prospect research.Physical DemandsYou must be able to lift up to 25 pounds without the assistance of another person. Performing physical activities that require considerable (40%+ of the day) use of your arms and legs and moving your whole body, such as climbing, lifting, balancing, walking, stooping, and handling of materials.Join our team!We're excited to welcome a Research and Data Manager who is passionate about what they do, driven, adaptable, principled, and a team player. This is a great opportunity to work with a dynamic team and make a difference.Apply today!
